summary: This is a memorandum from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) to the Federal Bureau of Prisons Office of Internal Affairs, transmitting investigative materials related to Correctional Officers Michael Thomas and Tova Noel. The OIG notes its investigation is not complete, but the case is no longer being prosecuted, so the materials are provided for administrative purposes.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Subject of OIG investigation and interview; BOP correctional officer.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Subject of OIG investigation and interview; BOP correctional officer.

connections.description: Both are Correctional Officers for the Federal Bureau of Prisons and are subjects of the same OIG investigation.

events.title: OIG Interviews of Correctional Officers
events.description: The Office of the Inspector General conducted interviews of Correctional Officers Michael Thomas and Tova Noel, documented in Memoranda of Investigation.

events.title: OIG Transmits Investigative Materials
events.description: The DOJ OIG transmits investigative materials regarding Thomas and Noel to the BOP Office of Internal Affairs for administrative purposes, noting the criminal case is no longer being prosecuted.

keyFacts: The document is an OIG memo transmitting investigative materials on BOP Correctional Officers Michael Thomas and Tova Noel (OIG# 2019-010614/OIA# 2019-05324).
The OIG investigation related to Thomas and Noel is not complete, but the criminal case is no longer being prosecuted.
The materials, including Memoranda of Investigation from October 8, 2021, regarding interviews of Thomas and Noel, are being provided to BOP Internal Affairs for administrative purposes.
